pr_title: Couchbase instrumentation should store normalized queries as db.statement

timeline.message: Couchbase instrumentation should store normalized queries as db.statement
Couchbase instrumentation should store normalized queries as db.statement

timeline.bodyText: does it make sense to use muzzle and split out separate instrumentation module for couchbase 2.5?
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Just a general remark: I think the fewer modules we have, the better :)
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
I think it's a trade-off of how much complexity we need to add in order to handle multiple incompatible versions in a single module
spring-webflux is the only other module that uses MethodHandle, and in that case adds much less complexity compared to this
all other modules currently use muzzle to handle incompatible versions
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: It turns out the situation is much more complicated: I was kinda lazy last time (😅 ) and did not check in which version which class appears, but I did it right now and it looks like we'd need 4 different instrumentations if we wanted to avoid using MethodHandles at all: 2.0.0 - 2.1.0, 2.1.0 - 2.2.0, 2.2.0 - 2.4.3, 2.4.3 - latest.
replies.author: mateuszrzeszutek

replies.bodyText:
yikes that's a lot of version dependency!
if we keep it in a single module, how do we get test coverage of these different versions? maybe we need a way to specify multiple versions for testLatestDeps?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Right now all tests use Couchbase 2.5.0 (common test code in couchbase-testing for both 2.0.0 and 2.6.0 instrumentations) and every query type except the 2.0.0-2.2.0 Query interface is covered. If we wanted to test that we'd probably need to refactor the testing module.
replies.author: mateuszrzeszutek

replies.bodyText: thx for explanations, approach / testing coverage seems reasonable to me
replies.author: trask
